snippet: In 1946, a polling firm told the newspaper that its name might be holding it back - both the "Wall Street" connotations and the "journal" ones. But no one considered what Rupert Murdoch is weighing: WSJ.
abstract: In 1946, a polling firm told the newspaper that its name might be holding it back - both the "Wall Street" connotations and the "journal" ones. But no one considered what Rupert Murdoch is weighing: WSJ.

headline.main: Murdoch Isn't the First to Consider Renaming The Wall Street Journal
